acceptOwnership().details: The new owner accepts the ownership transfer.

calculateAllocation(address).details: NB: We multiply out and then divide by the DENOMINATOR `PER` multiplier (e.g. xMultiplier of 1200000000/DENOMINATOR yields a 1.2x ).

claim().details: Claiming sets claim status pre-transferring avoiding reentry, and all multiplier tokens are soulbound avoiding transfer manipulation.

constructor.details: The primary and secondary factor (or their multipliers) can be address(0) or 0 but not all of them.

params._claimEnd: The timestamp when the claim period ends.

owner().details: Returns the address of the current owner.

pendingOwner().details: Returns the address of the pending owner.

renounceOwnership().details: While this will always revert, the onlyOwner is left in for consistency.

transferOwnership(address).details: Starts the ownership transfer of the contract to a new account. Replaces the pending transfer if there is one. Can only be called by the current owner. Setting `newOwner` to the zero address is allowed; this can be used to cancel an initiated ownership transfer.

CLAIM_END().notice: The timestamp when the claim period ends.

PRIMARY_CONDITIONAL_MULTIPLIER_ADDRESS().notice: The address of the contract providing an additional multiplier to the primary balance which requires DENOMINATOR division.

PRIMARY_FACTOR_ADDRESS().notice: The primary contract affecting airdrop calculation values by balance.

SECONDARY_FACTOR_ADDRESS().notice: The secondary contract affecting airdrop calculation values by balance.

calculateAllocation(address).notice: Calculates the claim value for an account for with either primary or secondary balances, or both.

claim().notice: Claims tokens for the caller account while the claiming is active.

withdraw().notice: Owner withdraws unclaimed tokens from the contract post claim end.

documentation.text: @dev Thrown when an address is the zero address.
@dev Thrown when the claim end is in the past.
@dev Thrown when all addresses and multiplier values are zero address or zero.
@dev Thrown when an address has already had their tokens claimed.
@dev Thrown when trying to claim after the claim period.
@dev Thrown when the owner tries to withdraw before the end of the claim period.
@dev Thrown when a user is attempting to claim zero tokens.
@dev Thrown when an owner attempts to renounce ownership.
@dev Denominator used for division when multiplying out the token allocation.
@notice The token contract.
@notice The timestamp when the claim period ends.
@notice The primary contract affecting airdrop calculation values by balance.

@notice The address of the contract providing an additional multiplier to the primary balance which requires
 DENOMINATOR division.
@notice The secondary contract affecting airdrop calculation values by balance.
@notice Mapping of claimed status.
@notice Owner withdraws unclaimed tokens from the contract post claim end.

@notice Overrides renounceOwnership preventing renouncing.
 @dev While this will always revert, the onlyOwner is left in for consistency.
